basics.name: Simeon Ogunbunmi
basics.label: Research Associate
basics.summary: Research Associate in Electrical and Computer Engineering with expertise in cybersecurity, UAV networks, blockchain technology, and edge computing. My work integrates machine learning, cryptography, and IoT systems to solve real-world problems in cyber-physical systems. Passionate about applied research, teaching, and collaborative innovation across disciplines.

work.name: Virginia State University
work.summary: Engineering OPC UA data pipeline using Prosys UA Client and Python to aggregate data from DMG MORI (DMU50) and environmental sensors, streaming processed data to Azure cloud for centralized storage and analysis.
highlights: Engineering an OPC UA data pipeline using Prosys UA Client and Python to aggregate data from DMG MORI (DMU50) and environmental sensors, streaming processed data to the Azure cloud for centralized storage and analysis
Building a real-time dashboard with OPC UA client integration to visualize machine and energy metrics, enabling continuous monitoring and actionable insights that improve system efficiency
Utilizing Python for data preprocessing and synchronization across sensor inputs, enhancing data integrity, and preparing datasets for advanced analytics and predictive modeling on Azure

work.name: Binghamton University
work.summary: Conducted research in Intelligent and Sustainable Edge Computing (I-SEC) Lab focusing on UAV security, blockchain technology, and edge computing systems.
highlights: Developed a reputation system for 5 UAVs using blockchain technology, ensuring the security and effectiveness of 60% of the datasets collected, with familiarity with cloud platforms

Developed a Python-based remote application for UAV telemetry secured using authenticated data exchange protocols and lightweight cryptographic checks. Integrated manual security validation during real-time data transmission

Enhanced the process of collecting data from the UAVs using Raspberry PI hardware to transpose collected data and utilized a reputation system to identify malicious data, reducing the chances of data compromise by over 30%
Conducted a thorough analysis and visualization of data collected from the experimental simulations using Excel
Developed Python-based applications for real-time telemetry and video data, with experience in handling high-volume streaming data pipelines comparable to VMS platforms

work.name: Hub Control

Conducted test rig on sampled heat pumps to control, measure, and evaluate the application's performance
Led a collaborative effort to develop and maintain monitoring applications, resulting in a 30% improvement in response times for system alerts
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to optimize infrastructure, resulting in a 30% increase in system efficiency and enabling faster response times for temperature control applications
